experiences.title: Systems/Software Engineer
experiences.subtitle: BAE Systems
workDescription: Started as a Systems Engineer working on a small team, moved over time towards full-time Software Engineering as my suitability for the role became apparent
Designed, built and deployed Android applications from scratch based on customer requirements (both formal and informal)
Managed a CI pipeline to run automated test suites and store development artefacts
Integrated the apps with several pieces of third-party hardware/software and ran end-to-end tests to ensure continuous functionality throughout development
Also developed a Python server backend - and an accompanying browser frontend interface using Vue.JS - to perform status monitoring of many Android devices from a management terminal
Skilled at applying iterative Agile processes (using both RTC and JIRA) to estimate and implement new features and bug fixes
Directly supported software adoption and training programmes by presenting the delivered system to users, administrators and maintainers
Plenty of experience with managing stakeholder relationships internally and externally - handling technical questions, discussing feature roadmaps and timelines, dealing with ad-hoc issues, etc.
Experienced with fully documenting the developed software, including general usage, configuration and expected behaviours under stress

experiences.title: Intern
experiences.subtitle: Toshiba Medical Visualisation Systems, Edinburgh
workDescription: 12-week internship project investigating the plausibility of HDR display output in future medical imaging products
Used C++ via DirectX 12 and new (at the time) HDR display features in Windows 10
Utilised common industry version control and development tools via Visual Studio as part of an existing team

experiences.title: Intern
experiences.subtitle: Astronomy Technology Centre, Edinburgh
workDescription: 8-week summer project developing a Windows application for viewing 3D data files in an Oculus Virtual Reality headset
Used C++ and the Unreal Engine alongside several third-party libraries
Ended with a functioning prototype taking advantage of the platform’s unique properties
